title: Protecting Law Enforcement Officers, Judges, Prosecutors, and Their Families

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to enhance protections for judges, prosecutors, law enforcement officers, and their families by easing access to concealed firearms, improving security measures, and proposing new legislation to strengthen these protections. It aims to reduce threats and intimidation faced by these public servants while promoting better privacy protections for their personal information.
potential_concerns: Easing concealed carry provisions may raise concerns about increased risks of firearm misuse or accidental harm.
Granting special deputation with firearm privileges but not full law enforcement powers could create legal or operational ambiguities.
Privacy protections may be difficult to uniformly implement given the variety of public information sources and state/local laws.
Heightened protections and penalties focused on a specific group may raise equity concerns among other vulnerable public servants or citizens.
Implementation timelines and agency compliance could be challenging given the complexity of removing obstacles and coordinating reviews.
